can we change it like 

int main(int /*argc*/, char** /*argv*/) 

And also this pathset is doing more than just meson migration, please mention that in the commit message.
Done

we generally use the regenerate tool from sdbusplus repo, rather than using a custom target for generating cpp & hpp files from the yaml files. check below link for more info.

https://github.com/openbmc/phosphor-led-manager/blob/master/meson.build#L78
I followed other repos doing this way. Thanks for providing the link. Will take a look.
trailing space ?
Ack
I dont see this option being used anywhere in the meson files ? should this go inside the conf.h
I was planning on using this option earlier. I don't think we need this option. Will remove.
I am confused , is this just doing a copy of a file from source dir to the build directory ?

Yes, it is. 

elog-errors.hpp was manually generated using elog-gen.py and meko template files. This script and the templates are neither in SDK nor getting installed in docker - there is an existing issue in phosphor-logging repo. The file was checked-in to the source directory after generating. I've seen other repos like for example /openbmc/phosphor-bmc-code-mgmt/elog-errors.hpp checked-in this file in the source directory. Just followed that.

If there is a better way to handle this, please let me know so that I can incorporate that.
same here
Done

AM_CONDITIONAL([INSTALL_ERROR_YAML], [test "x$enable_install_error_yaml" = "xyes"])
AS_IF([test "x$enable_install_error_yaml" != "xyes"], [
    # Checks for typedefs, structures, and compiler characteristics.
    AX_CXX_COMPILE_STDCXX_17([noext])
    AX_APPEND_COMPILE_FLAGS([-Wall -Werror], [CXXFLAGS])
    # Check for sdbus++
    AC_PATH_PROG([SDBUSPLUSPLUS], [sdbus++])
    AS_IF([test "x$SDBUSPLUSPLUS" == "x"],
        AC_MSG_ERROR(["Requires sdbus++"]))
    LT_INIT
    # Checks for libraries.
    AX_PKG_CHECK_MODULES([SYSTEMD], [], [libsystemd >= 221], [],
        [AC_MSG_ERROR(["systemd required and not found."])])
    # Checks for modules
    PKG_CHECK_MODULES([PHOSPHOR_LOGGING], [phosphor-logging],,
        [AC_MSG_ERROR([Could not find phosphor-logging...openbmc/phosphor-logging package required])])
])

I think we need to check for these dependencies only when the install_error_yaml option is enabled right ?
trailing space ?
Please include test details.
Done
are you planing separate commit for this support. or planing to use the autogenrated version. ?

The general impression I got after talking to Brad was to use autogenerated version of the error log file - like it was done in other repos. I like that idea, but wasn't sure. I left this work in TODO so that it gets your/Matt's attention for what should be done. 

I'll go with the recommendation from you/Matt. 

If we choose to have this option, it can go in a separate commit. If not, I can take this option out entirely.

I think I would say that since you already have elog-errors.hpp checked in, just go with that instead of creating it every compilation.  If the Boot.errors.yaml ever changes it would need to be regenerated with elog-gen.py, but I don't think that will happen much if ever.
Done
Make sense , checkstop handling functionality is moved to another openpower application. @matt can we complete remove the meson support related to auto genaration code and jsut use hard code version.
That sounds fine to me.

if this is enabled, we basically dont build anything. This looks the same even in autotools, i am not sure if we need this meson option at all in the first place.

But i would leave it to the maintainers of this repo to decide.
@matt Can you comment on this?

this was so that in an SDK and in the native step the Boot.errors.yaml would get copied out to phosphor-logging so it could include the errors in the global elog-errors.hpp. 

You couldn't skip this if:
* the errors contained metadata, which they don't.  Then phosphor-logging wouldn't include it in the error.
* you wanted to log errors from the global elog-errors.hpp in the same file as you wanted to log these.  This isn't the case either.
* Some other code wanted to create these errors, which they don't.

So I would say go ahead and just remove the install_error_yaml. You'll need to remove it from the recipe as well.
Done

now that you don't need to run sdbus++ during the build, I don't think you need this, or any of the code below that refers to generating files.

In fact, you don't need any of the new files you put in the 'gen' dir.

I have checked-in elog-error.hpp like in any other repos. To generate this we needed to have elog-gen.py.

The following code generates two files: error.hpp and error.cpp, and requires sdbus++. These are generated during build time. Are you saying we don't need these two files or simply check-in those files? Other repos do similar to what is being done here.
Oh, sorry, I forgot about the error.*pp files.
